title: AB de Royse777
author: AB de Royse777
created_time: October 03, 2023, 05:09:04 AMLast edit: October 03, 2023, 09:52:02 AM by Royse777
content: I have been an active member of the community since August 14, 2014, and I have been offering Bitcointalk Campaign Management (Signature & Bounty) for crypto projects since April 04, 2021. Throughout this longstanding relationship with the community, I have actively contributed to numerous historical events that support the Bitcoin community. Many members have vouched for my contributions multiple times. My feedback page, which currently boasts 20 positive feedback, serves as a substantial reference. Although there are 3 negative feedback from two different users. It simply explains that in 9 years of being part of a community, it is impossible to please everyone.Screenshot of feedback page.I kindly request you to first read the 3 negative feedback, then review my portfolio and navigate to the ACTIVE CAMPAIGN(s) section. I consistently deliver the best value to the clients I work with and to the members who assist me in executing campaigns under my management. I comprehend the significance of the ROI for your project and possess a profound understanding of the community's ecosystem. Through the perfect balance, when I oversee your campaign, both you and the campaigners are content with the results. This satisfaction is reflected in the 20 positive feedback I have received and the recognition from top brands within their respective industries.QuoteYou're doing really good job, never regretted choosing you =)- Sinbad.io ManagementQuotecould be better cuz adv prices currently are too high for any crypto projecta lot of money going to advertisingi think we have good results anyway- Yo!Mix Management.Sinbad.io Bitcoin Mixer, Yo!Mix mixer, [banned mixer] mixer are top and the biggest mixers right now in bitcoin mixer industry.Sherbet.com, Moneypot are two promising gambling platform who are slowly making their business bigger to have a place in the TOP of the industry. Mixin Safe a Billion dollar business network already trusted me with their marketing.Besides, 38+ projects I have managed in the past.In the past, I have held hundreds of thousands of dollars for campaigns. Even now, for the active projects mentioned above, I am holding over $35,000 worth of BTC in my personally secured wallet, which is a 2 of 2 multi-sig wallet. The annual turnover of my campaign management business exceeds $200,000. Bitcointalk Campaign Management (Signature & Bounty) has become a recognized brand within the community. Currently, 7 to 10 employees work for the brand on a full-time, part-time, or contract basis.I have never felt the need for a self-defense service discussion thread like this before. However, recently, I have considered it due to the false information being spread about my business by certain individuals. Over the years, I have also encountered jealousy from people, some of whom have gone to such extremes that one specific member called airfinex (though I believe there are a few others involved) has even contacted potential clients, attempting to dissuade them from hiring my services. An example of this is provided below.Image part -1Image part-2If you have received such a message already, I kindly request that you take a moment to thoroughly research all the information I have presented. Please examine the current projects and analyze their results. I urge you to conduct your own due diligence rather than swiftly changing your mind based on an unsolicited private message from a random Bitcointalk member. This individual appears to be retaliating, using selectively chosen quotes from different members to justify their actions. It's important to note that my business ranks among one of the top (I am sure members will give their opinion of what rank my service deserves) in this community, which receives three million monthly visitors.Your project deserves the expertise of the best marketing agency, and Bitcointalk Campaign Management (Signature & Bounty) is your ultimate trusted partner to elevate your brand to the top of your business niche.The thread is self-moderated (to prevent overzealous bad actors) and is exclusively open for constructive discussions. Forum members and clients who have collaborated with me are encouraged to share their opinions about their experience working together. Cheers,

comments.author: komisariatku
comments.body: I have joined your campaign and never had a problem paying. I think managing finances is not easy, money is always a source of problems and many people are tempted by money, but you are not like that. You have managed your finances well and I'm sure it's not easy and not many people can do itI think the person who gave you the red tag has never managed that kind of money and doesn't understand how difficult it is.I never doubted you and I think you are one of the best managers in this forum and one of the trustworthy members. have nice days royse777

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I also give my opinion honestly. I have worked with Royse77 on more than one signature campaign and all of them were wonderful.Royse77 has great professionalism in managing campaigns and is always trustworthy. There were no problems during those campaigns and things were going well and payments were made regularly without delays or errors. And everyone was satisfied (participants and the campaign team).It is difficult to find someone capable of managing so many large campaigns without causing problems or errors unless he has sufficient skill and experience. During my time on the forum, I did not hear that any campaign team asked Royse77 to step down from the campaign, and this is (sufficient evidence) that His high professionalism and good management of the campaign.Don't worry, Royse77, just carry on with your work professionally and honestly as you always did.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Royce might not be the most reputable member of this forum, but I am sure that he is not a bad player. For some times now he has cried out on some kind of reputational attacks of him which sometimes arises the case of doubt and uncertainty between him and his potential clients.I also know that those clients who will be doubtful of the proficiency and sincerity of Royse77 are new to this forum. There is no one who has been here for months who will not vouch for Royse77.This is a forum that gives people alot of freedom to act, especially the DT members but does not provide an opportunity to punish people who acted wrongly. Everyone will not like Royse77 which is understandable, but it is bad when such hatred is extended to his business and brand.Royse77 is trustworthy.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: Royse777 on October 03, 2023, 05:09:04 AMHowever, recently, I have considered it due to the false information being spread about my business by certain individuals. Over the years, I have also encountered jealousy from people, some of whom have gone to such extremes that one specific member called airfinex (though I believe there are a few others involved) has even contacted potential clients, attempting to dissuade them from hiring my services. An example of this is provided below.It's ridiculous only a few people have treated you like this. You don't deserve this. This is too much to reach out to projects and send such a PM.I have worked with Royse777 a lot of times. He was always professional and trusted with funds. This BitLucy is a very small part of his Bitcointalk forum journey but that must not anyhow reflect his reputation. He is/was such a nice guy that BitLucy owner deceived him so easily. But some people took that one single incident to damage his reputation. It doesn't make any sense. He has been trusted with a significant amount of funds. He already proved that he is trustworthy.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: <Shrug>I trust you, I am in a campaign you are running and as I said in another post we have even done trades.Quote from: Royse777 on October 03, 2023, 05:09:04 AMI have been an active member of the community since August 14, 2014, and I have been offering Bitcointalk Campaign Management (Signature & Bounty) for crypto projects since April 04, 2021. Throughout this longstanding relationship with the community, I have actively contributed to numerous historical events that support the Bitcoin community. Many members have vouched for my contributions multiple times. My feedback page, which currently boasts 20 positive feedback, serves as a substantial reference. Although there are 3 negative feedback from two different users. It simply explains that in 9 years of being part of a community, it is impossible to please everyone......And to a certain extent that sums it up. If you are more active then I am dealing with people in terms of campaigns and services then sooner or later something is going to go sideways and cause an issue.Could it be your fault? Possible. Could it be someone else's fault? Also possible. BUT if you are the one here you are the 'face' of what is going on so it's going to come back on you. Even if you don't deserve it.I would actually use the negatives as a selling point. Nobody is perfect. Something happened but you are still here doing campaigns. It's easy to trust people that have no negatives, but getting all these campaigns now shows that you are doing what you say and working your ass off to do it properly. You didn't cut and run. You could be here as Royce888 but you are not. You are here as you.-Dave

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: It is not easy to talk about a person like Royse777 in a brief or two paragraphs. He is a member with a long history full of accomplishments.I know Royse777 since late 2019 when he launched lending services for the first time and although I did not deal with him in lending, but I was noticing how integrated and his competence to management business. Then we worked together in the signing campaign for Bestchange and we were together among the few who defended Bestchange because of the attack on the service by many members (that campaign is still active for nearly 4 years today). Then we discussed a few times within the donation campaign that he launched during the Covid19 crisis (at that time, i wanted to help some of the needy, but it was not possible for many reasons). After the end of the Bitlucy crisis, which Royse777 was involved in (I blamed him at that time for his poor management of the crisis before the matter was finally remedied), I joined many of the signature campaigns he managed. Frankly, I found that he is a wonderful person, very understanding and managing his campaigns with a lot of professionalism, providing safety and cost-effectiveness for both; advertisers and participants in the campaigns.Just as I may thank him of his accomplishments in preserving Bitcointalk as a wonderful space that brings us together, I regret all the attacks led by many members who are jealous of his successes (there is no other explanation for all that drama led by some sick minds).

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: KingsDen on October 03, 2023, 11:58:24 AMRoyce might not be the most reputable member of this forum, but I am sure that he is not a bad player. Managing 38+ campaigns, and escrowing a significant amount of funds cannot be done by someone who does not have a serious reputation here. He had some falls, but in such situations, quality members are recognized, those who stand up after falling.Royse777, I did not overlook your thread in Reputation, only some offline circumstances did not allow me to write a reply there. Now the topic is closed, but I will probably start a new one to respond to responsibility and give my opinion on the whole matter.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: This is the first time I've worked with Royse and I find him easy to deal with, managing 38 or more campaigns is a feat for a manager here you cannot do that if you have a low-level reputation and you are not backed up with a load of experience, one only needs to check his campaign rule to see how he goes the extra mile in his campaign for both the project he is working and campaign participants.It's a win-win situation for the participants and the project, I always make it a point to recommend him if there's an opportunity, platforms who come here and need guidance on how everything works here should have Royse, and so I wish him success and be unbothered and concentrate on what he does best.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I don't actually see an urgent reason why you have to defend yourself. You may not have an unsullied reputation, but the trust feedback speaks for itself. You've got more than 20 green ones and only 2 red ones. In addition, you've also got solid and long-term clients. That must be something. To a company looking for an experienced and reliable campaign manager, that must weigh more than those below-the-belt PMs discouraging them of your services. If I put myself in the shoes of one who is reasonable and who is tasked to look for a great manager, I'd probably be curious about those cheap shots, but they certainly won't make me decide right there and then that you're out of the list. You're definitely a top candidate. Again, you've got the reputation as well as an incredible portfolio.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: As humans, we are prone to make mistakes no matter how careful we can be , mistakes will always be made as its in our DNA... Royse777 being human might have made some mistakes in the past of which he has paid for financially in trying to repair the damage done and redeeming himself over the years. But should these mistakes haunt him forever, no he/she deserves a second chance as his in good standing with the forum as can be seen by the several projects making use of his services running for several months without problems which is commendable!! If anything, campaign management services are seasonal and at the moment his services are currently among the most sort after which shows how much work his put in rebranding him/herself to get a clean sleeve in terms of reputation.All in All is a great manager.

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: I just wanted to say what I know about my experience working with you on more than one signature campaign. You are professional.There may be quite a lot of other advantages that Royse777 has in managing campaigns, but I want to say just one, Royse777 is a professional manager. My last experience under your management was the Sinbad signature campaign.We definitely have flaws as humans. That's natural. Writing that is often written also has typing errors, such as missing one letter, inverted letter placement, but errors and errors can still be edited to make the writing perfect.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Without fear or favor, I make bold to say this that Royse777 is amongst the best named managers on this platform. His services are well coordinated and are top notch. So far  my working with him have shaped my composition here on this platform. I have learnt a lot through his management styles. Little wonder he gets most of the best clients and services here on this platform. I must say this that his expertise is second to non and can not be compared in terms of achievements. So far, he has built a good reputation for himself here.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: I worked with Royse777 in the Sinbad campaign and I had no single regret. He managed the campaign very well and there was no single issue. For the months I stayed on the project, everything was perfect. There is no need to doubt the competence and integrity of Royse.

comments.author: Vispilio
comments.body: Royse is one of the most transparent and professional campaign managers I've ever interacted with. On Sinbad mixer, I see him introducing innovative features that boost both the reward structure for the participants and the overall appeal of Sinbad, it's easy to conclude any enterprise that hires him for Bitcointalk will have made a wise business decision.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: What an interesting way to spend your time on Bitcointalk. Follow someone's business ventures and contact those they work with or could possibly work with in private and suggest to them to change their minds. The BitLucy campaign left a very sour taste in his mind. For what it's worth, I have been a participant in some of your campaigns and haven't seen anything that would make me think twice about joining a campaign that you manage.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Royse is one of the most generous and trusted members of the forum. I have worked with him on a few signature campaigns and found him very honest and a respect worthy person. Other than signature campaigns I have also worked with him on two review campaigns and I can proudly say that the person is an amazing manager. All the work that I have done with Royse went very smoothly and I received my payments on time. That shows how good he is in management of funds and campaigns and any business who hires him for such work will see great results without any doubt.The members who are trying to degrade his reputation are the ones with internal hatred for him because I believe that Royse always give opportunity to the ones who deserve the opportunity. Royse is a manager who always give opportunity to the ones who work hard to contribute information on the forum. I got opportunity to work with Royse multiple times and surely I will love to work with him in future. I can confidently say that all the businesses, mixers, casinos, and other platforms that want to have proper marketing on this forum can trust Royse without any doubt.

comments.author: Shishir99
comments.body: I have also worked on his campaign. I do not count for how long I have worked, but I did not have any problem with his campaigns. I am a campaign participant and I can see how he cares about the quality of users' posts. Users get kicked out of the campaign if they cannot maintain the quality. This simply shows how he cares about his clients and their money. I would suggest his potential clients check the running projects that he is handling and how many projects he has handled so far. He does not have a single reason to scam anyone in the future. He can be a pretty good employe for your project. Good luck Roy!

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: I don't see why somebody would take it on as a job to attack another man's business/potential clients; this is the dumbest thing I've ever seen. This is wrong. I previously underestimated Royse's management skills since I was looking at it from a distance, but as I came closer, I realised I was mistaken; I've been working for Royse for months and there have never been any payment issues. He accounts for every dime that passes through his fingers, and there have been no complaints about mismanagement or poor management of fundsHe works his tail off to ensure that his clients get the most value for their money. Royse does not simply select users for a job; he selects the best and demands the best from the people he works with. Royse earned my respect even before I began working with him. Keep up your great work, Royse; you don't need public validation when your work history and forum reputation speak for itself. Keep up Royse!!!
